pageContext.claim: “I called up Novartis a month ago. They raised their drug prices very substantially. And there was no reason for them to do that. And I called up the heads of both companies and others, I say you can't do this. You can't raise your drug prices. This is not happening like that. And they immediately reduced their drug prices to the same price that it was the day before. They cut out the entire increase. And I respected them for doing that and I appreciated that they did it.”
pageContext.analysis: Novartis did initially freeze drug prices under pressure from the Trump administration, but along with other drug makers, they plan to raise prices again in 2019. Plus, an AP investigation found that increases in drug prices may have slowed, but they are not going down.
